pk.contender.earmouse

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • pk.contender.earmouse.Main
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ButtonGridFragment.AnswerSelectedListener, ConfirmDeleteDialog.ConfirmDeleteDialogListener, ConfirmResetDialog.ConfirmResetDialogListener, ModuleListFragment.OnModuleSelectedListener

    public class Main
extends Activity
implements ModuleListFragment.OnModuleSelectedListener, ButtonGridFragment.AnswerSelectedListener, ConfirmDeleteDialog.ConfirmDeleteDialogListener, ConfirmResetDialog.ConfirmResetDialogListener
    Main Activity class, starting point for the App and implementation of the Main activity. Also has code that will install a given set of Modules on the first launch of the app.
    Author:
    Paul Klinkenberg

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static boolean DEVELOPER_MODE
      Set to true to enable StrictMode testing
      private ActionMode mActionMode
      reference to the Activity's ActionMode, is null if the Activity is not in ActionMode
      private ModuleListAdapter mAdapter
      Adapter used by the Main Activity's ListView.
      private Dialog mDialog
      Dialog currently being shown or null if none.
      private static java.util.List<Module> mModules
      Lists all the Modules currently installed, used by the Main Activity's ListView adapter.
      private static java.lang.String PREFS_FIRSTLAUNCH
      The index of the currently selected entry in the ModuleListFragment
      static java.lang.String PREFS_NAME 
      private java.util.List<Module> selection
      when in ActionMode, this List contains all the Modules the user currently has selected.
      static java.lang.String SERVER_HOST
      The server address to use for fetching remote data
      static java.lang.String SERVER_PATH
      The path on the server where the data can be found
      static int SERVER_PORT
      The server port to use for fetching remote data
      static java.lang.String VERSION
      Version string, only used in About dialog.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Loads saved state and preferences, installs default package of modules if this is the first time the App runs, ties the volume controls to the media stream that we use and sets up the context actionbar (CAB).
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - the previously saved instance state, can be null.

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Close any open Dialogs to prevent window leak. Does not appear to be necessary for ActionMode dialogs.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        protected void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle outState)

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Implements the Manage and About Actionbar options.
        Parameters:
        item - Menu item that was selected
        Returns:
        False to allow normal menu processing to proceed, true to consume it here.

      • onModuleSelected

        public void onModuleSelected(View view,
                    int position)
        Listener for the attached ListView, handles item selection. Depending on the layout, either starts an ExerciseActivity Intent with the position of the clicked item or updates the ExerciseFragment to display the item at position.
        Specified by:
        onModuleSelected in interface ModuleListFragment.OnModuleSelectedListener
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the list item that was clicked.

      • loadModulesList

        private static java.util.List<Module> loadModulesList(Context ctx)
        Loads all the locally installed modules, and returns them as a sorted list.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context used for the File functions and the Module constructor.
        Returns:
        A List of all the modules locally installed on the device, can be empty.

      • refreshModuleList

        public static void refreshModuleList(Context ctx)
        Refreshes mModules to contain all the locally installed modules. Invalidates the current adapter used for the ListView in Main.
        Parameters:
        ctx -

      • getModuleList

        public static java.util.List<Module> getModuleList()
        Returns the value of mModules.
        Returns:
        the value of mModules.

      • installDefaultModules

        private void installDefaultModules()
        Install the default module_*.json files from the assets. Called only the first time the application runs to provide the user with a basic selection of Modules.

      • onClickPlay

        Defers click event on Play button to the ExerciseFragment (tablets only)
        Parameters:

      • onDeleteConfirm

        public void onDeleteConfirm(DialogFragment dialog)
        Handler for when user confirms to delete the selected modules. Will purge the selected modules, ask ExerciseFragment to display the module at index 0 and display a Toast indicating the successful removal.
        Specified by:
        onDeleteConfirm in interface ConfirmDeleteDialog.ConfirmDeleteDialogListener
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog that was clicked will be passed into the method.

      • onDeleteAbort

        public void onDeleteAbort(DialogFragment dialog)
        Handler for when the user aborts to delete the selected modules.
        Specified by:
        onDeleteAbort in interface ConfirmDeleteDialog.ConfirmDeleteDialogListener
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog that was clicked will be passed into the method.

      • onResetConfirm

        public void onResetConfirm(DialogFragment dialog)
        Handler for when user confirms to reset the selected modules. Resets the history of the selected modules and updates ModuleListFragment and ExerciseFragment and displays a Toast indicating the successful history reset.
        Specified by:
        onResetConfirm in interface ConfirmResetDialog.ConfirmResetDialogListener
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog that was clicked will be passed into the method.

      • onResetAbort

        public void onResetAbort(DialogFragment dialog)
        Handler for when the user aborts to reset the selected modules.
        Specified by:
        onResetAbort in interface ConfirmResetDialog.ConfirmResetDialogListener
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog that was clicked will be passed into the method.
